Hydroxychloroquine could have caused 17,000 deaths during Covid, study findsPOLITICO1/4/2024

Former US President Donald Trump said: ‘What do you have to lose? Take it.’

							<div class="sidebar-grid__content article__content">
																																	
<p>Nearly 17,000 people may have died after taking hydroxycholoroquine during the first wave of Covid-19, according <a href="https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S075333222301853X" target="_blank">to a study</a> by French researchers.</p>



<p>The anti-malaria drug was prescribed to some patients hospitalized with Covid-19 during the first wave of the pandemic, "despite the absence of evidence documenting its clinical benefits," the researchers point out in their paper, published in the February issue of Biomedicine & Pharmacotherapy.</p>



<p>Now, researchers have estimated that some 16,990 people in six countries — France, Belgium, Italy, Spain, Turkey and the U.S. — may have died as a result.</p>

<p>That figure stems from a study published in the Nature scientific journal in 2021 <a href="https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-021-22446-z" target="_blank">which reported</a> an 11 percent increase in the mortality rate, linked to its prescription against Covid-19, because of the potential adverse effects like heart rhythm disorders, and its use instead of other effective treatments.</p>



<p>Researchers from universities in Lyon, France, and Québec, Canada, used that figure to analyze hospitalization data for Covid in each of the six countries, exposure to hydroxychloroquine and the increase in the relative risk of death linked to the drug.</p>



<p>In fact, they say the figure may be far higher given the study only concerns six countries from March to July 2020, when the drug was prescribed much more widely.</p>



<p>Hydroxychloroquine gained prominence partly due to French virologist Didier Raoult who had headed the Méditerranée Infection Foundation hospital, but was later <a href="https://www.lemonde.fr/societe/article/2022/07/13/pierre-edouard-fournier-remplace-didier-raoult-a-la-tete-de-l-ihu-de-marseille_6134638_3224.html" target="_blank">removed</a> amid growing controversy.</p>



<p>It was also <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/apr/06/hydroxychloroquine-trump-coronavirus-drug" target="_blank">considered</a> something of a “miracle cure” by the then-U.S. President Donald Trump, who said: “What do you have to lose? Take it.”</p>

readabilityObject.title: Hydroxychloroquine could have caused 17,000 deaths during Covid, study finds
readabilityObject.content:
Paris court rejects appeal against chemicals giant over Vietnam War use of Agent Orange

Tran To Nga says she has had tuberculosis, cancer and type II diabetes after being exposed to the herbicide in 1966.

Aug 22 2 mins read

Congo to EU: Give us your mpox jabs

The European Commission says Europe responded immediately and is not holding back stocks.

Aug 20 6 mins read

Heightened mpox vigilance urged by EU as deadly virus spreads

The virus is fast-spreading in Africa, where it has claimed more than 500 lives this year.

Aug 16 4 mins read

European West Nile virus death toll reaches 8

Cases are higher this year in Spain and Greece, while Europe’s numbers are within an expected range.

Aug 12 2 mins read
readabilityObject.textContent:
Paris court rejects appeal against chemicals giant over Vietnam War use of Agent Orange					
				
			
			
							Tran To Nga says she has had tuberculosis, cancer and type II diabetes after being exposed to the herbicide in 1966.
			
			
			Aug 22		
	
	
	

	2 mins read



			
			
			
			
					

			


			

					
	
	
		
		

			
			
			
			
			
							
										
						Congo to EU: Give us your mpox jabs					
				
			
			
							The European Commission says Europe responded immediately and is not holding back stocks.
			
			
			Aug 20		
	
	
	

	6 mins read



			
			
			
			
					

			


			

					
	
	
		
		

			
			
			
			
			
							
										
						Heightened mpox vigilance urged by EU as deadly virus spreads					
				
			
			
							The virus is fast-spreading in Africa, where it has claimed more than 500 lives this year.
			
			
			Aug 16		
	
	
	

	4 mins read



			
			
			
			
					

			


			

					
	
	
		
		

			
			
			
			
			
							
										
						European West Nile virus death toll reaches 8					
				
			
			
							Cases are higher this year in Spain and Greece, while Europe’s numbers are within an expected range.
			
			
			Aug 12		
	
	
	

	2 mins read
